comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: T.F. Day, who was successful in crossing the Atlantic Ocean in a twenty-five-foot yawl, is contemplating another trip across the Atlantic. This time he hopes to break all previous records for small sailing yachts across the "pond," and will essay the trip in a new type of yacht -- a three-masted yawl. (Jan 1913- NYTimes)

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Frederick B. Thurber and Theodore Goodwin sailed the Atlantic in 1911 with Thomas Fleming Day in Seabird. The trip is descried in "ACROSS THE ATLANTIC IN SEA BIRD" which was serialized in Day's magazine, "The Rudder." See page 20 of books.google.com/books?id=P8I6AAAAMAAJ

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry in Wikipedia for each: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Fleming_Day en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_B._Thurber

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq and Richard Arthur Norton:  Thanks for the full names here.  We'll include these next time we update the description.
